Description: 20,000+ metabolites, lipids and peptides across 1650 diverse food types
Curated database of over 4,000+ molecular tastants (compounds associated with taste)
Most comprehensive repository of flavor compounds, with 25,000+ compounds linking them to natural ingredients
60,000 food-derived molecules with details on flavours, nutrients, and metabolites
Manually curated database and ontology of 195,000+ chemical entities of biological interest
A comprehensive (commercial) dictionary of food additives, flavors, natural constituents, and contaminants

Comprehensive database on polyphenol content in foods for over 35,000 content values for 500 polyphenols in over 400 foods. Information on polyphenol metabolism and data on the effects of food processing and cooking

Database containing around 1,200 polyphenols, terpenoids, alkaloids and other plant secondary metabolites present in commonly consumed foods, with information about dietary phytochemicals and their human and animal metabolites
atabase of all small molecules discovered from bacteria and fungi, with over 36,000 compounds

Over 40,000 mass spectrometry proteomics data, including protein and peptide identifications and the corresponding expression values, post-translational modifications and supporting mass spectra evidence
A national and international repository for over 1,800 studies and 100,000+ identified metabolites, metadata, and analysis tools
Gene expression data from 230 nutrigenomics (gene expression in response to nutrients) experiments
Fermentation performance data (titer/rate/yield), strain genetic modifications, and bioprocess conditions from ~7,500 publications
3,755 omics datasets, including genome, metagenome, metataxonome, and (meta)transcriptome sequences for microorganisms found in fermented foods, additives, and seasonings
A resource of Metagenome-Assembled Genomes (MAGs) from food, containing 1,950 newly sequenced food metagenomes and 583 publicly available ones
Fungal genome database with over 2,500 sequenced fungal genomes, valuable for optimizing fungal strains
A thermodynamics-based database with enzyme kinetics and stability data of thermophiles and hyperthermophiles (heat-tolerant microbes)
4,000+ chemicals and their toxicological risk assessments in food safety from the European Food Safety Authority
An FDA-run genomic reference database containing whole-genome sequences of foodborne pathogens and environmental isolates
The Global Individual Food Consumption Data Tool from the FAO and WHO, contains data across 100+ countries
A large-scale benchmark dataset of 475 food classes used for food recognition AI models

Insights from blind taste tests with a total of 3,834 omnivores evaluating 167 products across 19 categories (2025: 2,684 omnivores on 122 products in 14 categories; 2024: 1,150 omnivores on 45 products in 5 categories)
